metadata.ttm:title: Change of Name Agreement
metadata.ttm:desc: Changing the legal name of your business entity is a major step, and carries with it many issues that must be addressed. Your DUNS number may be affected, and you may need to change business information in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that the bulk of information that must accompany a Change of Name Modification is provided by the Contractor via the Upload Documents section.

div.p: You may submit a modification requesting
that your company be identified by a different
name.
In doing so, your DUNS may be impacted.
To begin with you will be asked if you would like to
replace the existing DUNS on this contract.
For the purpose of this demonstration we are going
to respond "Yes" and take you through the process.
Selecting Yes will reveal text boxes which allow you
to enter your new DUNS and Plus 4 number if
applicable.
Click "Save and Continue" to move on.
You will be asked to confirm that the
information appearing with your new DUNS number is
correct.
Review the new Corporate Information screen.
If there are any issues you must make corrections
on the SAM website at www.sam.gov.
eMod will take 24 hours for updates to be
reflected in the system.
If everything is correct, click "Save and Continue."
The list of information that must accompany such a
modification is provided by the uploaded documents
described here.
Additional required documents will include:
Documentation authenticated by a State
official, an opinion by your company's legal
counsel, and a list of all affected contracts and
purchase orders.
Review this information carefully
and make notes of what you will need to
provide when proceeding to the Upload Documents
section. For this screen, however, you should still
provide the CO with some information regarding the
reason for your change of name and a list of the
relevant documents that will be attached to this
mod request.
Enter this information in the text box provided.
To continue to the Upload Documents screen click
"Save and Continue."
